title: China
description: Pam stands up to Dwight when he makes cutbacks to save money in the building, but will Dwight have the last laugh? Meanwhile, the office is surprised and energized when Michael outsmarts Oscar in a debate about China.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [picks up pencil between his toes]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Twenty minutes a day Jim, that's all it takes. Twenty minutes a day, all feet, no hands and I'll have the pedi-dexterity of a chimp, and you'll be sitting there like an idiot. [attempts to place pencil in pencil sharpener] Okay. Here we go. Ah, yes. [accidentally kicks items from his desk onto Pam's]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you mind?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry Pam, allow me to write you an apology letter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [typing with his toes] D-E-A. Oop, backspace. A. Dear.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whistling, places cup of coffee onto Dwight's desk] Ahh, Thank you hands. Nothing else in the universe can do what you do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lifts cup up with toes]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, don't worry about it. Dwight, its okay. You were wrong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [spills hot coffee on himself] Uhh, aah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, A for effort right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [taps Jim's hand with his foot]

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Welcome, start your morning right with a burst of blueberry. Or try plain.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's the occasion?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Dwight said this entry was a waste of space.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I would like a muffa du blueberry por favor.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Eight dollars.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Eight dollars?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Owning a building is a war between the landlord and the tenant. Not a literal war, unfortunately, but I am using the same tactics. I've surrounded the enemy, and I'm slowly starving them. To save on electricity I've installed a timer and motion sensors on the lights. It's part of my green initiative. And by green, I mean money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [examines items on the reception desk] Mmhmm, China. China.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How was the dentist?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was great. China.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you okay, what's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everything here was made in China, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, its where they make stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They used to make stuff in America, Andy. But we're falling behind, did you know that? China is a sleeping dragon that is just beginning to stir.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, right here. It is right there. [holds up magazine] Anybody read the news any more?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: China is on the move?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I found that in the waiting room at the dentist's office. This kid had the magazine I wanted to read, that's the only one I could reach and I read it and then I read it again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My whole life I believed that America was number one, that was the saying. Not America is number two. England is number two. China should be like eight.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You gotta stop texting me so much.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But I wanted you to know that Michael and I are wearing the same tie today. It's insane.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You need to change your standard for what's worthy of a text. Ask yourself is this something Darryl needs to know. The answers almost always no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Got it. Then I will call you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There was a time when the only people who texted you were people you wanted to text you. Girls. And they'd all say the same thing. "I'm coming over baby." And I would text back "BTB", bring that booty.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Dwight, why is the toilet paper only half a ply?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry, isn't that good enough for your anus? Don't get me started on how coddled the modern anus is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm, Stanley. Maybe you could just unspool a little more each time you need to...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Don't tell me how to do my business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stanley, as a fellow Dunder Mifflin employee I feel for you. But, like you, I am completely powerless to the whims of the new building owner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which is you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Which is you" is not a sentence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I disagree with.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Are you just gonna sit there, Office Administrator, or are you going to do something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, can we talk about these cutbacks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, when I'm sitting at this desk, I'm a salesman. If you wanna talk to the new building owner, you should call Nate and schedule and appointment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not going to do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well then you're not going to talk to the new building owner. Which is a shame, because I hear he's a very reasonable guy.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [on the phone] Y'ello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi Nate, Its Pam Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Oh, hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, I would just love to schedule a meeting today with Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Let me put you on hold for just one 'eensy sec.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [answers phone] Dwight Schrute. Mhm. Tell her I'm busy. I don't know, make something up.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Hey Pam, Dwight's being questioned by the police in connection with a string of dog-nappings that ha...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hangs up phone] Dwight. Dwight. Can you please tell new building owner that he is screwing over all the people he works with, people he's worked with for years. His friends.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what Pam? You're right. This isn't just a business. This is a home, and I would much rather see a smile from Kevin than save hundreds on plumbing and electricity. [Kevin smiles]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: According to the internet, the tallest man in the world is Chinese.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So much for keeping our secrets up high.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What's America gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know what we're going to do. We're going to put our best minds on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody stop working. I want you all to imagine a world in which America is not the number one superpower, where forks are irrelevant, and where every man, woman and child is expected to learn how to play the cello. Now open your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You never told us to close them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome to your future.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What do we do? How do we stop this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do we stop it? With a big idea. That's what America is built on, big ideas. Blue jeans, the Grand Canyon. Whose got one, whose got a big idea?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: An idea bigger than the Grand Canyon?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, indeed. Yes Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: An antacid that you only take once a week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Once a week antacid is the idea to beat. Anyone else? Nobody? Okay then we are... yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael! An antacid pill that you take once every six weeks.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why not just go one for the year?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's too big of a pill to swallow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What if we all get together and help each other and hire a new guy, and then we all kill him, but first we take out like a hundred thousand dollar life insurance policy. I bet you guys like that idea don't you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think that's what they're doing to me. I can't prove it, but I wanted to see their faces when I said it. I learned nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know what the [expletive] that was.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I say we bomb 'em. By 2020, they're gonna be the world's largest economy and they're getting a taste for protein. We'll all starve.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, Dwight's right we should drop a bomb.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No he's not right. We're not. Where would we even drop it, Phyllis? Did you know that in China there are fifty six cities with over a million people? You know how many we have here? Nine.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [gasps]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, that's not true. I know the figure you're referring to, and it's a projection of fifteen years from now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. That is right now.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, China's agrarian. Urbanizing fast? You bet 'cha, but still agrarian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In terms of land, not population.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come on Michael. You can...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no you're wrong about this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Where are you getting this information?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got it from NewYorkTimes.com

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh oh, getting nervous Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, someone look it up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm on it Jim. I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guys its not worth it really. Guys this is not worth our time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [reads text] "Are you watching this?" Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well are you?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm sitting right here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Got it. China has fifty six cities with a population of over one million. The US has... nine.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Suck it Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well on the plus side all this worrying about China has made you smarter than Oscar, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Great. I was wrong. I'm wrong. Is everyone happy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I happen to know more than the smartest guy in the office. So what? [laughs] I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, now where were we before I bested Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow, so this building can get uglier.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I will not work in a roach billboard.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh my God, I can't look at roaches.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael do something about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely, Pam this is exactly why I hired you as Office Administrator, handle it. Taking care of business.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight take it down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm serious, take it down or else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or else? Or else what? There's nothing you can do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can move out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [lights turn off] Really? [jumps to try and activate motion sensor, Kevin walks through the door setting it off, and the lights come back on]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, does anyone wanna know where I've been for the last 2 hours?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh God, I've been playing Zombie Soccer for two hours?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I went out to look for a better office space.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not really, because I found one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh wow, these are nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me see.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Look at the huge offices Jim, check out that conference room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. Totally.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't just move out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh in three months we can. Check the lease, and if you don't undo all the changes you've made, we're moving. Hey guys, can I show you some pictures.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [without looking at the pictures] Oh my gosh she is so cute. She looks like both of you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're not of Cece.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is possibly our new Dunder Mifflin office.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well I like being in the same building as Bob. Keeps me honest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, this building isn't far, and its much newer. There's a dry cleaner, nail place and a gym. Oh, and it's next-door to and Outback so it always smells like steak.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Are you trying to kill me?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is the nail place Koreans or whites?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Koreans.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Good. And the dry cleaners?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: White.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Woah, there is a lot of brainpower in this room. We've got Michael and Oscar, the two smartest guys in the office, also in that order.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Funny Jim. That is funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very comedically humorous Jim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I have a computer question. Hey Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Can you move aside so that I can ask Michael?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Alright. Alright I get it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Michael, how do I create a new tab?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Try 'Control P'.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's print.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not if the printer isn't hooked up. You are making some very dangerous assumptions Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oscar it must be killing you to know that Michael is smarter than you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's... he's not smarter than me, he was just right about one thing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but it was a really smart thing to be right about, actually.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Actually, it was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Around here, Oscar is known as 'actually' because he will insert himself into just about any conversation to add facts, or correct grammar. He really does fit that old stereotype of the smug gay Mexican.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [reading text] Megan Fox. Question mark. What's that mean?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Megan Fox! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You know what, you're one bad text away from getting blocked.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, but one good text away from a high five.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You accept these terms?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, its on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In your perfect would, what would make this building awesome? I'm putting together kind of a wish list.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, I wish for a million wishes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, no. I'm not a genie. I'm just talking about a...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Then see you later building.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't possibly be serious.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I said see you later building.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was thinking about some of the stuff you said earlier about China.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'd love to talk more about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe over some coffee later?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Woah, woah, woah. Do you know what you just agreed to?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coffee Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is not just coffee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's trying to set you up Michael. What's going to happen is he's going to try and bring up what ever you're talking about in a very casual way, but secretly he'll be trying to trip you up, and when he does, boom, its awful. Haven't you noticed that I don't bring up the Tour de France around him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And then he will smugly pay the cheque and make you feel so small.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, well I just need to learn everything about China. To be safe I should learn everything about everything but I don't have time. Okay, okay, I'll just learn about China and science and geography and math and literary.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No politics?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm pretty good on politics. "California is bankrupt, and California, California." [Jim and Andy follow Michael into his office] What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Parley, my office, five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Parley?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Pirate code, he wants to meet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So everyone here knows pirate code?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I understand it, I can't speak it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, I am not an unreasonable man. If you guys stay, I will stop watering down the soap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You've been watering down the soap?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why do you even need soap? Are you that bad at going to the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need everything back the way it was.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't wanna move. Moving is one of the most stressful things you can do in life. You'll probably just take it out on your kid. Jim will turn to the drink. The family will fall apart, and twenty five years from now, Cece will become world famous...  for stripping.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's a sad story. I have another one. We move, the other tenants follow, the bank takes the building, takes your farm, takes your car and beats the crap out of you. Penniless, you die, and my daughter Cece dances on your grave... fully clothed. [lights turn off, Pam and Dwight begin to wave their arms to alert the sensor]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Where is Tibet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pass.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: When was China founded?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pass.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Two for two, keep it up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Who is Mao?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lifeline.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Damn it. Michael, you are moments away from the smack down of your life. If you don't know something, steer the conversation back to something you do know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could talk about boobs. I bet he knows nothing about boobs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you know about boobs?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, I have to tell you something it's from Rocky II.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This guy doesn't just wanna win. Y'know, he want's to bury you. He wants to humiliate you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait. How long is this going to take?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm like a quarter of the way through.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it going to be worth it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Just in case Michael, I made you a cheat sheet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't need to cheat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Show him how to use it.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [riding in car, looking for new office] Ten thousand seven hundred and six.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here it is, right here, pull over. Oh my God. No way. Man, look at that.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's no building. This could only mean one thing.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: The building's underground?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She was lying. Oh, Pam, Pam...

quotes.speaker: {dwight} & {nate}
quotes.text: Pam, Pam, Pam, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Passer-by
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Pam. Pam?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Passer-by
quotes.text: I'm Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: No you're not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry. We have a colleague with the same name.

quotes.speaker: Passer-by
quotes.text: Oh, that's fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, okay. You're not a liar too are you?

quotes.speaker: Passer-by
quotes.text: I've been known to bend the truth.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it, Pam. Get out. Right now. Leave it, I mean it. Get the hell out of here. Go.

quotes.speaker: Passer-by
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't wait to do to Pam, what I just did... to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Y'know what, I'm the only one here who you haven't asked about the new office.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know, because you're the reason we're moving.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but I'm still an employee here, and that part of me is really excited about the change of scenery. What's the square footage in the new place?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhh, I think it's something like umm...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's the exact square footage.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm, let me see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How many offices are there? Oh I'll just look at the one sheet myself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, actually I don't know what I did with the one sheet. Y'know, that's the problem. You only have one sheet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [chuckles] You're a funny guy Pam. What's the first thing you guys are gonna do when you move in to the new office? I'm going to walk down the hall and say "Wow, I can't believe this is real, but it is." I can't wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I lied about some aspects of the building.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's still on a bike path though right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's no building... it doesn't exist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I needed leverage so I pulled those pictures off the internet. It's just this Office Administrator thing, I don't wanna...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Fail. I don't want to fail... again.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you didn't fail.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And that's what you said about Art School, and that's what you said about sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And you didn't fail those things either.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I'm not an artist, and I'm not a salesman. So what would you call it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, the reason I asked you down here for this chat is that I've been thinking that your fears about China are a bit exaggerated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you know, that China has a new missile, that can sink a US Naval Carrier nine hundred miles off the coast?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We have missiles too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you also know that China has secretly been expanding its nuclear arsenal. But what do I know, I mean, that's just according to the Pentagon. Our Pentagon.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I wasn't here. [places a book in front of Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I wasn't here. It's a pretty common saying. You may want to log it away for future use.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well thanks.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: China has been loaning us billions upon billions of dollars. We are going to be owing them for the rest of our lives. And they will control us.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, we're in a mild recession right now. I'll give you that, but people use China as the boogie man for all their problems. In the nineteen eighties, it was Japan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How then do you explain that in the past year manufacturing in China has risen by 17% and in the US it has only risen by 8%?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Do you really think that manufacturing is a relevant indicator of where the world economy's heading in 2011? Do you know the comparative expansion of say the information sector? I'd say that's far more relevant. Wouldn't you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't... I...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello, hello. You're breaking the law.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible, I love the law.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Read article nineteen. There are suitable standards that you have to maintain the building at that includes comfortable temperatures and adequate lighting. It also means no more cutting the tampons in two, and no more tampering with the toilet paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I see I've underestimated you, and I didn't think that was possible. Nate, reply the paper.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I don't think it goes that way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Reply it!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Don't worry about the coffee, its on me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I figured that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, I am so happy that we were able to have this little chat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait. You forgetting something?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This chat. Two men, one white, one latina. A boss and a money cruncher. I could fire you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Fire him. No, show mercy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we are.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's your point.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My point is... that as long as people like you and me don't stop talking, nobody can stop the USA.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Right, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am talking about freedom, about choice. America, I don't think you need to worry. Because if you want to beat China you will. If you don't, that's fine. That my friend, is your victory. Y'know, a lot of people say if you dig long enough and hard enough you will get to China, and that may be the true, but what they don't tell you is that if you dig long enough and hard enough in a conversation, you get to a friend. So here is to conversation.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Raise your cups on high. Case closed.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That wasn't what we were discu... That wasn't the whole...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They say the best vampires don't bleed their victims dry, but give them the strength so that they can bounce back only to be fed on again. I spared Pam, and I may feast off of her profits for years to come. I let Pam win. Haha, oh. I was not motivated by compassion. I have no compassion. Make sure you got that. Not motivated by compassion.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [reads text] Come to parking lot. Crazy pigeon action?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Shhh. You're gonna scare 'em away. [two pigeons are eating out of a soft serve cone]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [laughs] That's a text. [high fives Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's your new standard.
